greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Quotient A003415(n+k)/A003415(n) for the least k > 0 for which such a quotient is an integer. Here A003415(x) is the arithmetic derivative of x.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..16385
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 2..65537
example: Arithmetic derivative of 6 is A003415(6) = 5. Not until at k=21 we find another number whose arithmetic derivative is a multiple of five (as A003415(21) = 10 = 2*5), thus a(6) = 10/5 = 2.
xref: Cf. A003415, A328235 (gives the corresponding k).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 08 2019
